conditions: Calculated as the amount it would cost to repair or replace Covered Property, at the time of loss or damage, with material of like kind and quality, subject to a deduction for deterioration, depreciation and obsolescence.
Applies to valuation of Covered Property regardless of whether that property has sustained partial or total loss or damage.
May be significantly less than its replacement cost.

exclusions: Structural damage consisting merely of the settling or cracking of a foundation, structure or building does not constitute loss or damage resulting from a catastrophic ground cover collapse.
conditions: Earth Movement exclusion does not apply.
Does not increase the applicable Limit of Insurance.
Only one Limit of Insurance will apply regardless of whether loss or damage also qualifies as Sinkhole Loss or Earth Movement (if covered).

exclusions: Building decay that is hidden from view, if the presence of such decay is known to the Insured prior to collapse.
Insect or vermin damage that is hidden from view, if the presence of such damage is known to the Insured prior to collapse.
conditions: Must be an abrupt falling down or caving in of a building or any part of a building with the result that the building or part of the building cannot be occupied for its current intended purpose.

Must be caused by or resulting from one or more of the following: Building decay (hidden from view, unless known prior to collapse), Insect or vermin damage (hidden from view, unless known prior to collapse), Use of defective material or methods in construction, remodeling or renovation (if abrupt collapse occurs during construction, remodeling or renovation, or if after completion and caused in part by F.1., F.2., Defined Causes of Loss, Breakage of building glass, Weight of people or personal property, Weight of rain or snow or ice that collects on a roof), Catastrophic Ground Cover Collapse.
Means Fire, Lightning, Explosion, Windstorm or Hail, Smoke, Aircraft or Vehicle Impact, Riot, Strike or Civil Commotion, Vandalism and Malicious Mischief, or Leakage from Fire Protection Equipment.
Physical damage to covered equipment that is a direct result of an Accident.

Accident means a fortuitous event that causes direct physical loss or damage to Covered Property, specifically: Mechanical breakdown (including rupture/bursting by centrifugal force), Artificially generated electrical current (including arcing), Explosion of steam boilers/pipes/engines/turbines (owned/leased/controlled by Insured), Loss/damage to steam boilers/pipes/engines/turbines caused by condition/event inside, Loss/damage to hot water boilers/other water heating equipment caused by condition/event inside.
Per Statement of Values or other documentation on file with the Program Manager.

exclusions: Not extended to the Additional Time Element Coverages for Soft Costs and Royalties.
conditions: Per Statement of Values or other documentation on file with the Program Manager.
Insurance provided under the coverage part for Time Element Coverage is extended to the coverage provided by this endorsement.
If a deductible is shown in a schedule, the period of interruption will begin immediately after the accident or electronic circuitry impairment, and the deductible shown in the schedule will apply.
The most the Companies will pay for loss or expense under this coverage is the applicable limit for Time Element Coverage provided, unless otherwise show in a schedule.
Companies will pay for the Insured's reasonable and necessary cost to research, replace and restore lost Electronic Data and Media.

The most the Companies will pay for loss or expense under this coverage, including actual loss of covered Time Element the Insured sustains and necessary covered Extra Expense the Insured incurs, is $100,000 unless otherwise shown in a schedule.
Companies will pay the reasonable extra cost to make temporary repairs and expedite permanent repairs or permanent replacement for damaged Covered Property.

The most the Companies will pay for loss or expense under this coverage, including actual loss of covered Time Element the Insured sustains and necessary covered Extra Expense the Insured incurs, is $100,000 unless otherwise shown in a schedule.
Any insurance provided under the coverage part for Green Upgrades is extended to the coverage provided by this endorsement.

The most the Companies will pay for loss or expense under this coverage, including actual loss of covered Time Element the Insured sustains and necessary covered Extra Expense the Insured incurs, is $25,000 unless otherwise shown in a schedule.

exclusions: Contamination of perishable goods by refrigerant, including but not limited to ammonia.
conditions: Companies will pay the Insured's additional cost to repair or replace Covered Property because of contamination by a hazardous substance, including additional expenses to clean up or dispose of such property.
Additional costs mean those beyond what would have been payable under this Equipment Breakdown Coverage had no hazardous substance been involved.

The most the Companies will pay for loss, damage or expense under this coverage, including actual loss of covered Time Element the Insured sustains and necessary covered Extra Expense the Insured incurs, is $100,000 unless otherwise shown in a schedule.

exclusions: Accident or electronic circuitry impairment occurring in any country in which the United States has imposed sanctions, embargoes or similar restrictions on the provision of insurance.
conditions: Companies will pay for physical damage to transportable covered equipment that, at the time of the accident or electronic circuitry impairment, is not at an insured Location.

Companies will also pay for the Insured's reasonable and necessary cost to research, replace and restore lost Electronic Data and Media contained within covered equipment, not to exceed the limit applicable to Data Restoration coverage.

The most the Companies will pay for loss, damage or expense under this coverage, including actual loss of covered Time Element the Insured sustains and necessary covered Extra Expense the Insured incurs, and Data Restoration, is $100,000 unless otherwise shown in a schedule.

exclusions: Does not apply to the direct result of an electronic circuitry impairment.
conditions: Included in Time Element and/or Spoilage.
Applies only to the direct result of an accident.
Only applies if the Insured has sustained an actual loss of Time Element covered under this endorsement.

Companies will pay for the Insured's reasonable costs for professional services to create and disseminate communications, when the need for such communications arises directly from the interruption of the Insured's business. Communication must be directed to: The media, The public, or The insured's customers, clients or members.

Means, whether natural or manmade: Flood waters, surface water, waves, tide or tidal water, tsunami, overflow or rupture of a dam, levee, dike, floodgates, or other surface containment structure, storm surge, the rising, overflowing or breaking of boundaries of natural or manmade bodies of water, or the spray from any of the foregoing, all whether driven by wind or not.

Water which backs up or discharges from sewers, drains or sumps is a separate Covered Cause of Loss and is not considered Flood; unless such backup or discharge was caused by Flood as defined above, at which point the backup or discharge shall be considered Flood.

exclusions: The cost of filling sinkholes.
Sinking or collapse of land into man-made underground cavities.
conditions: Means: The sudden sinking or collapse of land into underground empty spaces created by the action of water on limestone or dolomite.

exclusions: Sinking or collapse of land into man-made underground cavities.
Earthquake.
conditions: Means loss or damage to Covered Property when 'structural damage' to the covered Building, including the foundation, is caused by settlement or systematic weakening of the earth supporting the covered Building, only if the settlement or systematic weakening results from contemporaneous movement or raveling of soils, sediments, or rock materials into subterranean voids created by the effect of water on a limestone or similar rock formation.

Includes stabilization of the Building (including land stabilization) and repair to the foundation, provided such work is in accordance with Florida Insurance Law and in accordance with the recommendation of a professional engineer and with notice to the Insured. Engineer must be selected or approved by the Companies.
Until Insured contracts for stabilization/repair, Companies will not pay for underpinning/grouting/other repair technique below existing foundation, and payment may be limited to Actual Cash Value.
Insured must contract for stabilization/repair within 90 days after Companies notify of coverage.
If engineer determines repairs exceed Limit of Insurance before contract or start of work, Companies must complete repairs or pay Limit of Insurance.
If determination made during repair work, Companies must complete repairs or pay remaining portion of Limit of Insurance.
Most Companies will pay for total Sinkhole Loss (including stabilization/repair) is the applicable Limit of Insurance on the affected Building.
Stabilization and all other repairs must be completed within 12 months after contracting, unless: mutual agreement, neutral evaluation process, litigation, or appraisal/mediation.
Insured has right to participate in neutral evaluation program administered by Florida Department of Financial Services if claim denied or report received from engineer/geologist.
Companies pay reasonable costs of neutral evaluation.
Participation in neutral evaluation extends time for filing suit by 60 days or five years, whichever is later.
Does not increase the applicable Limit of Insurance. Only one Limit of Insurance will apply even if loss also qualifies as Catastrophic Ground Cover Collapse.
Claim is barred unless notice is provided within two years after Insured knew or reasonably should have known about the Sinkhole Loss.

If Companies deny claim without testing (section 627.7072, Florida Statutes), Insured may demand testing in writing within 60 days. Insured is responsible for 50% of testing costs or $2,500, whichever is less. Companies reimburse if engineer/geologist certifies sinkhole loss.
Insured may not accept a rebate from any person performing repairs; otherwise, coverage is void and Insured must refund rebate to Companies.

If Companies deny claim based on engineer/geologist certification of no sinkhole loss and claim was submitted without good faith grounds, Insured reimburses Companies for 50% of analysis/services costs (or $2,500, whichever is less), if Insured requested analysis and was informed of potential for reimbursement.
As precondition to accepting payment, Insured must file a copy of any Sinkhole report regarding the property with the county clerk of court. Insured bears filing/recording cost.

exclusions: Any Cyber Loss, unless subject to paragraph 2.

Loss, damage, liability, claim, cost, expense of whatsoever nature directly or indirectly caused by, contributed to by, resulting from, arising out of or in connection with any loss of use, reduction in functionality, repair, replacement, restoration or reproduction of any Data, including any amount pertaining to the value of such Data, unless subject to paragraph 3.
Any amount pertaining to the value of Data, to the Insured or any other party, even if such Data cannot be recreated, gathered or assembled.
conditions: Supersedes and replaces any conflicting wording in the Policy or any endorsement thereto having a bearing on Cyber Loss, Data or Data Processing Media.

Covers physical loss or physical damage to property insured under this Policy caused by any ensuing fire or explosion which directly results from a Cyber Incident, unless that Cyber Incident is caused by, contributed to by, resulting from, arising out of or in connection with a Cyber Act (including action taken in controlling, preventing, suppressing or remediating any Cyber Act).

Should Data Processing Media owned or operated by the Insured suffer physical loss or physical damage insured by this Policy, then this Policy will cover the cost to repair or replace the Data Processing Media itself plus the costs of copying the Data from back-up or from originals of a previous generation. These costs will not include research and engineering nor any costs of recreating, gathering or assembling the Data. If such media is not repaired, replaced or restored the basis of valuation shall be the cost of the blank Data Processing Media.

exclusions: Loss caused by the Insured's failure to use due diligence and dispatch and all reasonable means to resume business
Any increase in loss resulting from an agreement between the Insured and the Insured's customer or supplier
conditions: Failure or disruption of service must be caused by an accident to equipment owned by a utility, landlord, landlord's utility or other supplier providing services (electrical power, waste disposal, air conditioning, refrigeration, heating, natural gas, compressed air, water, steam, Internet access, telecommunications services, cloud computing services, wide area networks or data transmission).
Equipment must meet the definition of covered equipment except that it is not Covered Property.
Cloud computing services must be provided by a professional provider with whom the Insured has a contract.

Coverage for Time Element or Data Restoration will not apply unless the failure or disruption of service exceeds 24 hours immediately following the accident. If it exceeds 24 hours, coverage begins at the time of disruption, and the applicable deductible applies.
Physical damage to perishable goods due to spoilage.
Physical damage to perishable goods due to contamination from the release of refrigerant, including but not limited to ammonia.

Necessary expenses the Insured incurs to reduce the amount of loss under this coverage to the extent that they do not exceed the amount of loss that otherwise would have been payable under this coverage.

If the Insured is unable to replace the perishable goods before its anticipated sale, the amount of payment will be determined on the basis of the sales price of the perishable goods at the time of the accident or electronic circuitry impairment, less discounts and expenses the Insured otherwise would have had. Otherwise, payment will be determined in accordance with the Valuation provision.

coverages.coverage_name: Time Element, Data Restoration or Spoilage (under Service Interruption)
conditions: Costs must be incurred during the period of interruption or up to 30 days after the period of interruption has ended.

coverages.coverage_name: Data Compromise Response Expenses - 1st Party Named Malware
Data Compromise Response Expenses - Forensic IT Review
exclusions: costs to analyze, research or determine vulnerabilities in systems, procedures or physical security
costs to analyze, research or determine compliance with Payment Card Industry or other industry security standards
costs to analyze, research or determine the nature or extent of loss or damage to data that is not "personally identifying information" or "personally sensitive information"
conditions: Applies only if all of the following conditions are met: There has been a "personal data compromise"; Such "personal data compromise" took place in the "coverage territory"; Such "personal data compromise" is first discovered by you during the "policy period"; Such "personal data compromise" is reported to us as soon as practicable, but in no event more than 60 days after the date it is first discovered by you.

If there is reasonable cause to suspect that a covered "personal data compromise" may have occurred, we will pay for costs covered under Forensic IT Review, even if it is eventually determined that there was no covered "personal data compromise". However, once it is determined that there was no covered "personal data compromise", we will not pay for any further costs.

coverages.coverage_name: Data Compromise Response Expenses - Legal Review
conditions: Applies only if all of the following conditions are met: There has been a "personal data compromise"; Such "personal data compromise" took place in the "coverage territory"; Such "personal data compromise" is first discovered by you during the "policy period"; Such "personal data compromise" is reported to us as soon as practicable, but in no event more than 60 days after the date it is first discovered by you.

If there is reasonable cause to suspect that a covered "personal data compromise" may have occurred, we will pay for costs covered under Legal Review, even if it is eventually determined that there was no covered "personal data compromise". However, once it is determined that there was no covered "personal data compromise", we will not pay for any further costs.

coverages.coverage_name: Data Compromise Response Expenses - Public Relations Services
conditions: Applies only if all of the following conditions are met: There has been a "personal data compromise"; Such "personal data compromise" took place in the "coverage territory"; Such "personal data compromise" is first discovered by you during the "policy period"; Such "personal data compromise" is reported to us as soon as practicable, but in no event more than 60 days after the date it is first discovered by you.
Applies only if there has been a notification of the "personal data compromise" to "affected individuals" as covered under item (3) below.

coverages.coverage_name: Data Compromise Response Expenses - Regulatory Fines and Penalties
conditions: Applies only if all of the following conditions are met: There has been a "personal data compromise"; Such "personal data compromise" took place in the "coverage territory"; Such "personal data compromise" is first discovered by you during the "policy period"; Such "personal data compromise" is reported to us as soon as practicable, but in no event more than 60 days after the date it is first discovered by you.
Applies only if there has been a notification of the "personal data compromise" to "affected individuals" as covered under item (3) below.

coverages.coverage_name: Data Compromise Response Expenses - PCI Fines and Penalties
conditions: Applies only if all of the following conditions are met: There has been a "personal data compromise"; Such "personal data compromise" took place in the "coverage territory"; Such "personal data compromise" is first discovered by you during the "policy period"; Such "personal data compromise" is reported to us as soon as practicable, but in no event more than 60 days after the date it is first discovered by you.
Applies only if there has been a notification of the "personal data compromise" to "affected individuals" as covered under item (3) below.

coverages.coverage_name: Computer Attack and Cyber Extortion - Loss of Business
Computer Attack and Cyber Extortion - Public Relations
Computer Attack and Cyber Extortion - Cyber Extortion
Data Compromise Liability - 3rd Party Named Malware

conditions: Services (c) and (d) apply only to 'affected individuals' from 'personal data compromise' events involving 'personally identifying information'.
Credit Report and Monitoring is subject to the 'affected individual' enrolling for this service with the designated service provider.
Identity Restoration Case Management applies to 'affected individual' who is or appears to be a victim of 'identity theft' that may reasonably have arisen from the 'personal data compromise'.

exclusions: Promotions provided to any of your directors or employees
Promotion costs exceeding $25 per 'affected individual'

conditions: To the extent such fine or penalty is legally insurable under the law of the applicable jurisdiction.

exclusions: Increased transaction costs
conditions: Imposed under a contract to which you are a party.
Conditions for Computer Attack must be met: 'computer attack' occurred, in 'coverage territory', first discovered during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of discovery.
Conditions for Computer Attack must be met: 'computer attack' occurred, in 'coverage territory', first discovered during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of discovery.
Conditions for Computer Attack must be met: 'computer attack' occurred, in 'coverage territory', first discovered during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of discovery.
Conditions for Computer Attack must be met: 'computer attack' occurred, in 'coverage territory', first discovered during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of discovery.
If you suffer a covered 'business income and extra expense loss'.
Conditions for Computer Attack must be met: 'computer attack' occurred, in 'coverage territory', first discovered during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of discovery.
Conditions for Cyber Extortion must be met: 'cyber extortion threat' occurred, first made during 'policy period', reported within 60 days of being made.
Payment of 'cyber extortion expenses' must be approved in advance by us.
You must make every reasonable effort not to divulge the existence of this Cyber Extortion coverage.
Notice of 'claim' or 'regulatory proceeding' first received during 'policy period' or Extended Reporting Period.

'Claim' or 'regulatory proceeding' arises from a 'personal data compromise' that took place during 'coverage term', in 'coverage territory', and was submitted to us and insured under Data Compromise Response Expenses.
'Claim' reported within 60 days of receipt.
Notice of 'claim' first received during 'policy period' or Extended Reporting Period.
'Claim' arises from a 'network security incident' that took place during 'coverage term' and in 'coverage territory'.
'Claim' reported within 60 days of receipt.
Notice of 'claim' first received during 'policy period' or Extended Reporting Period.
'Claim' arises from an 'electronic media incident' that took place during 'coverage term' and in 'coverage territory'.
'Claim' reported within 60 days of receipt.
'Identity theft' involving personal identity of an 'identity recovery insured' occurred.
'Identity theft' took place in 'coverage territory'.
'Identity theft' first discovered by 'identity recovery insured' during 'policy period'.
'Identity theft' reported within 60 days of discovery.
Available for up to 12 consecutive months from inception of service.
'Identity theft' involving personal identity of an 'identity recovery insured' occurred.
'Identity theft' took place in 'coverage territory'.
'Identity theft' first discovered by 'identity recovery insured' during 'policy period'.
'Identity theft' reported within 60 days of discovery.
Fees and expenses for an attorney approved by us for the defense of any civil suit brought against an “identity recovery insured”.
Fees and expenses for an attorney approved by us for the removal of any civil judgment wrongfully entered against an “identity recovery insured”.
Fees and expenses for an attorney approved by us for legal assistance for an “identity recovery insured” at an audit or hearing by a governmental agency.
Fees and expenses for an attorney approved by us for legal assistance in challenging the accuracy of the “identity recovery insured’s” consumer credit report.

Fees and expenses for an attorney approved by us for the defense of any criminal charges brought against an “identity recovery insured” arising from the actions of a third party using the personal identity of the “identity recovery insured”.

exclusions: Does not include sick days or any loss arising from time taken away from self-employment.
Necessary time off does not include time off to do tasks that could reasonably have been done during non-working hours.
conditions: Actual lost wages of the “identity recovery insured” for time reasonably and necessarily taken away from work and away from the work premises.
Time away from work includes partial or whole work days.
Actual lost wages may include payment for vacation days, discretionary days, floating holidays and paid personal days.

coverages.coverage_name: Child and Elder Care Expenses (Identity Recovery)
conditions: Actual costs for supervision of children or elderly or infirm relatives or dependents of the “identity recovery insured” during time reasonably and necessarily taken away from such supervision.
Such care must be provided by a professional care provider who is not a relative of the “identity recovery insured”.
Actual costs for counseling from a licensed mental health professional.
Such care must be provided by a professional care provider who is not a relative of the “identity recovery insured”.

exclusions: Costs to avoid, prevent or detect “identity theft” or other loss.
Money lost or stolen.
Costs that are restricted or excluded elsewhere in this Coverage Form or policy.
conditions: Any other reasonable costs necessarily incurred by an “identity recovery insured” as a direct result of the “identity theft”.
Such costs include: Costs by the “identity recovery insured” to recover control over his or her personal identity.
Such costs include: Deductibles or service fees from financial institutions.
The words "Sinkhole Loss" are deleted from the Earth Movement definition in Section VIII.J.5. of the Compass 04 18 Form.
The Compass Form is extended to cover Sinkhole Loss, as defined under Section VIII.BB.

exclusions: Loss or damage arising directly or indirectly from nuclear detonation, nuclear reaction, nuclear radiation or radioactive contamination, however such nuclear detonation, nuclear reaction, nuclear radiation or radioactive contamination may have been caused.

Loss or damage occasioned directly or indirectly by war, invasion or warlike operations (whether war be declared or not), hostile acts of sovereign or government entities, civil war, rebellion, revolution, insurrection, civil commotion assuming the proportions of or amounting to an uprising, military or usurped power or martial law or confiscation by order of any Government or public authority.
Loss by seizure or illegal occupation.

Loss or damage caused by confiscation, requisition, detention, legal or illegal occupation, embargo, quarantine, or any result of any order of public or government authority which deprives the Insured of the use or value of its property, nor for loss or damage arising from acts of contraband or illegal transportation or illegal trade.

Loss or damage directly or indirectly arising from or in consequence of the discharge of pollutants or contaminants, which pollutants and contaminants shall include but not be limited to any solid, liquid, gaseous or thermal irritant, contaminant of toxic or hazardous substance or any substance the presence, existence or release of which endangers or threatens to endanger the health, safety or welfare of persons or the environment.
Loss or damage by chemical or biological release or exposure of any kind.
Loss or damage by attacks by electronic means, including computer hacking or the introduction of any form of computer virus.

Loss or damage caused by vandals or other persons acting maliciously or by way of protest or strikes, riots or civil commotion unless physical loss or damage is caused directly by an Act of Terrorism.

Loss or increased cost occasioned by any Public or Civil Authority's enforcement of any ordinance or law regulating the reconstruction, repair or demolition of any property insured hereunder; unless this ordinance or law extension is also covered by the Policy's other insured perils.
Any consequential loss or damage caused by any other ensuing cause.
Loss of use, delay or loss of markets, however caused or arising, and despite any preceding loss insured hereunder.
Loss or damage caused by cessation, fluctuation or variation in, or insufficiency of, water, gas or electricity supplies and telecommunications of any type or service.
Loss or increased cost as a result of threat or hoax, in the absence of physical damage due to an Act of Terrorism.
Loss or damage caused by or arising out of burglary, house - breaking, theft or larceny or caused by any person taking part therein.

Loss, damage, cost or expense or whatsoever nature directly or indirectly caused by, resulting from or in connection with any actual or threatened existence, growth, release, transmission, migration, dispersal, or exposure to Mold, Spores, or Fungus, regardless of any other cause or event contributing concurrently or in any other sequence to the loss.
Buildings with values greater than $250,000,000.
Buildings or locations where animal testing is conducted.
Embassies and Government owned & occupied buildings (State and Local Municipalities and/or Hospitals do not apply to this exclusion).
Abortion Clinics.
Property located in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Property in Transit not on the Insured's premises.
conditions: Insures Real and Personal Property against direct physical loss or physical damage by an Act of Terrorism, as herein defined, occurring during the period of this Policy as stated in the Declarations Page.

An Act of Terrorism means an act, including the use of force or violence, of any person or group(s) of persons, whether acting alone or on behalf of or in connection with any organisation(s), committed for political, religious or ideological purposes including the intention to influence any government and/or to put the public in fear for such purposes.
The burden of proving that the loss is recoverable under this Policy and that no limitation or exclusion of this policy applies and the quantum of loss shall fall upon the Insured.
The Underwriters hereon shall not be liable for more than the sum insured stated in the Supplemental Declarations Page in respect of each occurrence.
Each occurrence shall be adjusted separately and from the amount of each such adjusted loss the sum stated in the Deductible Endorsement shall be deducted.
The term "Occurrence" shall mean any one loss and/or series of losses arising out of and directly occasioned by one Act or series of Acts of Terrorism for the same purpose or cause.

The duration and extent of any one "Occurrence" shall be limited to all losses sustained by the Insured at the property insured herein during any period of 72 consecutive hours arising out of the same purpose or cause.

No such period of 72 consecutive hours may extend beyond the expiration of this policy unless the Insured shall first sustain direct physical damage by an Act of Terrorism prior to expiration and within said period of 72 consecutive hours nor shall any period of 72 consecutive hours commence prior to the attachment of this Policy.

Any protection provided for the safety of the insured property shall be maintained in good order throughout the currency of this Policy and shall be in use at all relevant times, and that such protection shall not be withdrawn or varied to the detriment of the interests of the Underwriters without their consent.

This Policy is effected solely between the Insured and Underwriters. This Policy shall not confer any benefits on any third parties, including shareholders, and no such third party may enforce any term of this Policy. The Contract (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 is expressly excluded from this Policy.
This clause shall not affect the rights of the Insured. Any Loss Payees and/or Mortgagees shall be included in loss payments, as their interests may appear.

exclusions: Increase in loss resulting from interference at the insured premises, by strikers or other persons, with rebuilding, repairing or replacing the property or with the resumption or continuation of operation.

Increase in loss caused by the suspension, lapse, or cancellation of any lease, licence, contract, or order, unless such results directly from the insured Interruption of Business, and then Underwriters shall be liable for only such loss as affects the Insured's earnings during, and limited to, the period of indemnity covered under this Policy.

Increase in loss caused by the enforcement of any ordinance or law regulating the use, reconstruction, repair or demolition of any property insured hereunder; unless this ordinance or law extension is also covered by the Policy's other insured perils.

Loss of market or other consequential loss, except as respects loss resulting from Interruption of Business (if covered), to an Insured's covered Location due to INTERRUPTION BY CIVIL OR MILITARY AUTHORITY and/or INGRESS & EGRESS, from an Act of Terrorism to real property not owned by the Insured.
Loss as a result of physical or mental or bodily injury to any person.
conditions: Extended to cover loss resulting from necessary Interruption of Business, relating only to the premises affected by the Act of Terrorism, caused by Direct Physical Loss or Damage of an Act of Terrorism, as covered by the Policy to which this Extension is attached, to property insured by this Policy.

Extended to cover loss resulting from Interruption of Business (if covered) to an Insured's covered Location due to INTERRUPTION BY CIVIL OR MILITARY AUTHORITY or INGRESS & EGRESS, from an Act of Terrorism, to real property not owned by the Insured.
Only for the SUBLIMITS OF LIABILITY stated elsewhere in this policy; however, in no event to exceed $1,000,000 per occurrence.

No claim shall be payable under this Extension unless and until a claim has been paid, or liability admitted, in respect of Direct Physical Loss or Damage by an Act of Terrorism to property insured under the Policy to which this Extension is attached and which gave rise to Interruption of Business.

This Condition shall not apply if no such payment shall have been made, or liability admitted, solely owing to the operation of a Deductible in said Policy which excludes liability for losses below a specified amount.

This Condition shall be amended to include Direct Physical Loss or Damage to real property not owned by the Insured, but only as respects INTERRUPTION BY CIVIL OR MILITARY AUTHORITY or INGRESS & EGRESS if covered under this policy.

exclusions: The Companies will not pay for "cosmetic damage" to "roof surfacing" caused by wind and/or hail.
conditions: Cosmetic damage means that the wind or hail caused marring, pitting or other superficial damage that altered the appearance of the roof surfacing, but such damage does not prevent the roof from continuing to function as a barrier to entrance of the elements to the same extent as it did before the cosmetic damage occurred.

Roof surfacing refers to the shingles, tiles, cladding, metal or synthetic sheeting or similar materials covering the roof and includes all materials used in securing the roof surface and all materials applied to or under the roof surface for moisture protection, as well as roof flashing.

exclusions: Any other explosion, except as specifically covered under this endorsement
Any criminal, fraudulent or dishonest act, error or omission, or any intentional or knowing violation of the law by you.
Vandalism and Malicious Mischief does not include loss or damage caused by or resulting from theft, except for real property loss or damage caused by the breaking in or exiting of burglars.

War and military action including undeclared or civil war, warlike action by military force, insurrection, rebellion, revolution, usurped power, political violence or action taken by governmental authority.
Any 'personal data compromise', 'computer attack', 'cyber extortion threat' or 'wrongful act' occurring before the 'coverage term'.
Any increase in loss resulting from an agreement between the Insured and the Insured's customer or supplier (for Time Element and Service Interruption coverages)
That part of any 'claim' seeking any non-monetary relief (does not apply to 'defense costs' from an otherwise insured 'wrongful act').

U.S. Terrorism Risk Insurance Act of 2002 as amended Not Purchased Clause: This Insurance therefore affords no coverage for losses directly resulting from any "act of terrorism" as defined in TRIA except to the extent, if any, otherwise provided by this policy.

The terms and limitations of any terrorism exclusion, or the inapplicability or omission of a terrorism exclusion, do not serve to create coverage for any loss which would otherwise be excluded under this Coverage Part or Policy, such as losses excluded by the Nuclear Hazard Exclusion or the War and Military Action Exclusion.
Any fines or penalties other than those explicitly covered under Data Compromise Response Expenses.
Accident or electronic circuitry impairment caused by or resulting from: Smoke; aircraft or vehicles; riot or civil commotion; sprinkler leakage; elevator collision

The propagation or forwarding of malware, including viruses, worms, Trojans, spyware and keyloggers in connection with hardware or software created, produced or modified by you for sale, lease or license to third parties.
The theft of a professional or business identity.
Nuclear reaction or radiation or radioactive contamination, however caused.
Smoke does not include loss or damage caused by or resulting from Smoke from agricultural smudging or industrial operations.
An 'identity theft' that is not reported in writing to the police.

Flood, surface water, waves, tides, tidal waves, overflow of any body of water, or their spray, all whether driven by wind or not; mudslide or mudflow; or water that backs up or overflows from a sewer, drain or sump
Costs to research or correct any deficiency.
Any threat, extortion or blackmail including, but not limited to, ransom payments and private security assistance (except a 'cyber extortion threat' as defined and covered).
Any loss or damage to animals
Any criminal investigations or proceedings.
Explosion of gas or unconsumed fuel within the furnace of any boiler or fired vessel or within the passages from that furnace to the atmosphere
Vandalism

Accident or electronic circuitry impairment caused by or resulting from: Windstorm or hail (unless covered equipment within a building suffers an accident from windblown rain, snow, sand or dust, and the building did not first sustain wind or hail damage to its roof or walls)

Any Fungus, Mold(s), Mildew, Spores or Yeast including any presence, growth, proliferation, spread or any activity of Fungus, Mold(s), Mildew, Spores or Yeast (unless it's spoilage of perishable goods covered under Spoilage coverage)
Your intentional or willful complicity in a covered loss event.

The following are not explosions within the intent or meaning of this definition: Electric arcing or any coincident rupture of electrical equipment due to such arcing; Bursting or rupture caused by freezing; Sonic shock waves, generally known as Sonic Boom; Bursting, rupture or collapse of any safety disc, rupture diaphragm or fusible link.
Any oral or written publication of material, if done by you or at your direction with knowledge of its falsity.
Accident or electronic circuitry impairment caused by or resulting from: Lightning
Your reckless disregard for the security of your computer system or data, including confidential or sensitive information of others in your care, custody or control.

Certified Act of Terrorism Exclusion: The Companies will not pay for loss or damage caused directly or indirectly by a "Certified Act of Terrorism". Such loss or damage is excluded regardless of any other cause or event that contributes concurrently or in any sequence to the loss.

If aggregate insured losses attributable to terrorist acts certified under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act exceed $100 billion in a calendar year and the Companies have met their insurer deductible under the Terrorism Risk Insurance Act, the Companies shall not be liable for the payment of any portion of the amount of such losses that exceeds $100 billion, and in such case insured losses up to that amount are subject to pro rata allocation in accordance with procedures established by the Secretary of the Treasury.
Windstorm or Hail: no liability is assumed under this peril for loss or damage caused by or resulting from frost or cold weather, ice (other than hail), snow or sleet, whether driven by wind or not.
Any earth movement, including but not limited to earthquake, subsidence, sinkhole collapse, landslide, earth sinking, tsunami or volcanic action
Any attack on, incident involving, or loss to any computer or system of computers that is not a 'computer system'.
'Property damage' or 'bodily injury' other than mental anguish or mental injury alleged in a 'claim' covered under Electronic Media Liability.

Any fraudulent, dishonest or criminal act by an 'identity recovery insured' or any person aiding or abetting an 'identity recovery insured', or by any 'authorized representative' of an 'identity recovery insured', whether acting alone or in collusion with others (unless the 'identity recovery insured' has no knowledge of or involvement).

Explosion does not include loss or damage occasioned by or incident to explosion in or of the following equipment owned, operated or controlled by the Insured: Steam boiler, steam turbines, steam engines, and steam pipes interconnecting any of the foregoing; Moving or rotating machinery or parts thereof when such direct loss or damage is caused by centrifugal force or mechanical breakdown; Any products manufactured by the Insured or other property attached thereto or forming or to form a part thereof undergoing pressure tests to the extent of the loss to such property.
Failure or interruption of or damage to the internet or an internet service provider.
The Insured's failure to use all reasonable means to protect Covered Property from damage following an accident or electronic circuitry impairment
Fire, including smoke from a fire
Accident or electronic circuitry impairment caused by or resulting from: Water or other means used to extinguish a fire

Accident or electronic circuitry impairment caused by or resulting from: Breakage of glass; falling objects; weight of snow, ice or sleet; freezing (caused by cold weather); collapse or molten material
Loss caused by the Insured's failure to use due diligence and dispatch and all reasonable means to resume business (for Time Element and Service Interruption coverages)

No (re)insurer shall be deemed to provide cover and no (re)insurer shall be liable to pay any claim or provide any benefit hereunder to the extent that the provision of such cover, payment of such claim or provision of such benefit would expose that (re)insurer to any sanction, prohibition or restriction under United Nations resolutions or the trade or economic sanctions, laws or regulations of the European Union, United Kingdom or United States of America.
special_conditions: Legal action against insurer requires full compliance with terms and must be brought within two years after 'loss'/'identity theft' discovered or 'claim'/'regulatory proceeding' notice received.

For Locations within 100 miles of the closest salt water of the Atlantic Ocean or the Gulf of Mexico, if added to the policy or if coverage is increased at an existing Location during the term of the Policy, and coverage exists at any time during June 1st to November 1st, the premium will be calculated at 100% of the annual rate, less the Unearned Factor. Otherwise, the additional premium shall be computed pro-rata.
Proof of mailing will be sufficient proof of notice of cancellation.
The provisions of the cancellation clause replace any short rate provisions stipulated in this Policy, all subject to the Minimum Earned Premium provisions.
Insurer may provide Case Management services prior to determination of covered 'identity theft', but this is not an admission of liability.

OFAC Regulations: If it is determined that you or any other insured, or any person or entity claiming the benefits of this insurance has violated U.S. sanctions law or is a Specially Designated National and Blocked Person, as identified by OFAC, this insurance will be considered a blocked or frozen contract and all provisions of this insurance are immediately subject to OFAC restrictions. When an insurance policy is considered to be such a blocked or frozen contract, no payments or premium refunds may be made without authorization from OFAC. Other limitations on premiums and payments also apply.
Any cause of loss set forth in exclusion b.(2)(d) above that is not a Covered Cause of Loss in this coverage part shall be excluded only as respects Service Interruption coverage.
Agreement on service provider(s) for Notification to Affected Individuals and Services to Affected Individuals must be reached prior to Pre-Notification Consultation.

Arbitration Clause: All matters in difference between the Insured and the Companies in relation to this insurance, including its formation and validity, and whether arising during or after the period of this insurance, shall be referred to an Arbitration Tribunal.
Insured agrees to consult with insurer prior to notification to 'affected individuals'. Insurer assumes no responsibility for services promised without prior agreement.

This policy shall comply with laws and regulations of the controlling jurisdiction regarding cancellation and nonrenewal, and any provisions that conflict are modified to comply minimally with such laws or regulations.

For Locations within 100 miles of the closest salt water of the Atlantic Ocean or the Gulf of Mexico, if the Insured cancels this Policy, removes a Location, or reduces the amount of insurance on a Location, and coverage existed any time during June 1st to November 1st, the return premium will be the Unearned Premium for the Location based on a provided Unearned Factor table.

In event of 'personal data compromise', 'identity theft', 'computer attack' or 'cyber extortion threat', insured and 'identity recovery insured' must notify police if law broken, notify insurer within 60 days, provide description, permit inspection/examination/sampling/copying, send signed sworn proof of 'loss' within 60 days of request, cooperate, resume operations quickly if intending to continue business, and make no statement assuming obligation or admitting liability without prior written consent.
If this Policy is cancelled, the Companies will send the First Named Insured any premium refund due.
Limit of insurance for Extended Reporting Periods is part of, not in addition to, the limit of the immediately preceding 'policy period'.
The cancellation will be effective even if the Companies have not made or offered a refund. If notice is mailed, proof of mailing will be sufficient proof of notice.

Actual Cash Value (ACV) basis for: Property not currently serving a useful function, Covered Property not repaired/replaced within 24 months, or Covered Property specified for ACV in a schedule. ACV includes depreciation.

The Compass clauses for Section II- Covered Causes of Loss, B. Exclusions, 16. Electronic Data & Media; Section IV- Valuations, E. Electronic Data and Media; and Section VIII- Policy Definitions, L. Electronic Data and Media are deleted.
Miscellaneous Unnamed Costs are subject to a sublimit and limited to costs incurred within 12 months after first discovery of 'identity theft'.
Insured may request a defense attorney of their choice; insurer will give full consideration.

Coverage for Services to Affected Individuals is limited to costs for up to one year from notification date, except Identity Restoration Case Management services initiated within that year may continue for up to one year from initiation date.
If other insurance applies, this Coverage Form is excess.
Nothing in the cancellation clause will act to provide coverage outside the automatic acquisition clause elsewhere in the Policy.

If an alternate service provider is used, they must be approved, provide reasonably equivalent or superior services, and insurer's payment will not exceed what would have been paid to suggested provider.

Suspension: Companies' representatives may immediately suspend insurance if covered equipment is found to be in, or exposed to, a dangerous condition. Reinstatement only by endorsement. Pro rata refund of premium for the period of suspension.
Jurisdictional Inspections: Companies agree to perform inspections for state or municipal boiler and pressure vessel regulations on the Insured's behalf.
Identity Recovery is not subject to a deductible.
Insurer will only pay for services provided by approved service providers. Insured must obtain prior approval.
The seat of the Arbitration shall be in New York and the Arbitration Tribunal shall apply the law of New York as the proper law of this insurance.
Insurer is not legal advisor.
Insured must give written notice as soon as practicable if incidents may give rise to a 'claim' or 'regulatory proceeding'.
Public Relations coverage is also subject to a limit per 'affected individual' as described in A.1.b.(5).
If an event is first discovered in one 'policy period' but causes loss in subsequent periods, all loss is subject to the limit of the period when first discovered.

Property held for sale by the Insured will be valued at sales price (less discounts/expenses) if: manufactured by Insured, sales price is less than replacement cost, or Insured unable to replace before anticipated sale.
If a 'claim' or 'regulatory proceeding' is first received in one 'policy period' but causes loss in subsequent periods, all loss is subject to the limit of the period when first received.
Insured may not voluntarily make payment, assume obligation, or incur expense without insurer's prior written consent, except at own cost.

A decision agreed to by any two members of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be binding. The award of the Arbitration Tribunal shall be in writing and binding upon the parties who covenant to carry out the same.

Deductibles for Each Coverage: Unless the schedule indicates that the Insured's deductible is for all coverages, multiple deductibles may apply to any one equipment breakdown. Companies will not pay until the amount of covered loss exceeds the deductible amount indicated for that coverage. If deductibles vary by type of covered equipment and more than one type is involved, only the highest deductible for each coverage will apply.
Deductible applies to all 'loss' from the same insured event or interrelated events under Data Compromise Response Expenses or Computer Attack and Cyber Extortion.

Coinsurance: If a coinsurance percentage is shown, Companies will not pay the full amount of loss if the applicable limit is less than the product of the coinsurance percentage times the value of the property. Coinsurance applies separately to each insured Location.
If other insurance applies, Supplemental Extended Reporting Period coverage is excess.
Deductible applies to 'loss' exceeding the deductible amount shown in Supplemental Declarations.
Data Compromise Sublimits apply to Forensic IT Review, Legal Review, Public Relations, Regulatory Fines and Penalties and PCI Fines and Penalties for 'loss' from any one 'personal data compromise'.

Location(s) requested to be added to this policy will be underwritten based upon each location's individual risk characteristics, as well as the underwriting rules, rates, deductibles, and coverage terms in effect with the Program Manager at the time of the request.
Mental Health Counseling is subject to a sublimit and limited to counseling within 12 months after first discovery of 'identity theft'.
Automatic Extended Reporting Period of 30 days at no additional premium following 'termination of coverage'.

If a 'claim' or 'regulatory proceeding' is brought, insured must record specifics, provide written notice within 60 days, send copies of legal papers, authorize records, cooperate, and assist in enforcement of rights.

This Policy can be cancelled by the First Named Insured by providing the Companies with an advanced written request for cancellation stating when the cancellation shall be effective, and the original Policy or a lost policyholder release signed by the First Named Insured or its legal representative.
All services may not be available or applicable to all individuals (e.g., minors, foreign nationals).
Effectiveness of services depends on cooperation and assistance.
Cyber Suite Aggregate Limit applies to all 'loss' under all applicable coverage sections, except Identity Recovery, in any one 'policy period' or any applicable Extended Reporting Period.

Electronic Data and Media: Mass-produced/commercially available software at replacement cost. All other Electronic Data and Media at cost of blank media for reproducing records. No payment for financial records based on face value.
The Arbitration Tribunal may not award exemplary, punitive, multiple, consequential, or other damages of a similar nature.

1st Party Named Malware sublimit applies to 'malware-related compromise' under Data Compromise Response Expenses (all 'malware-related compromises' caused by the same virus/malicious code are a single 'personal data compromise').
If insured refuses settlement recommended by insurer, insurer may withdraw from defense; insurer's liability limited to settlement amount plus defense costs incurred prior to refusal.
Legal Costs under 'identity recovery expenses' are part of the aggregate limit for Identity Recovery.
Insurer does not warrant or guarantee services will end or eliminate all problems.

This Policy may be cancelled by the Companies by giving to the Insured at least ninety (90) days written notice of cancellation or in the case of non-payment of premium or material misstatement, at least ten (10) days written notice of cancellation.

Time Deductible: If a time deductible is shown, Companies will not be liable for any loss occurring during the specified number of hours or days immediately following the accident or electronic circuitry impairment.
Identity Recovery Case Management Service is available for up to 12 consecutive months from inception of service; expenses do not reduce aggregate limit.
Pre-notification consultation includes providing exact list of 'affected individuals', information about the 'personal data compromise', and scope of desired services.

Multiple of Average Daily Value (ADV): If a deductible is expressed as a number times ADV, it's calculated based on Time Element earned during the period of interruption divided by working days. The ADV applies to the entire Location.

Insured agrees to use due diligence to prevent and mitigate 'loss', including complying with and requiring vendors to comply with reasonable and industry-accepted protocols for physical security, computer/Internet security, data backups, transaction protection, and disposal of sensitive files.
Insurer may examine insured under oath.
Except for 'identity recovery case manager' services, insured has direct relationship with professional service firms.
Dollar Deductibles: Companies will not pay until the amount of loss exceeds the applicable deductible shown in the schedule.

3rd Party Named Malware sublimit applies to 'malware-related compromise' under Data Compromise Liability (all 'malware-related compromises' caused by the same virus/malicious code are a single 'personal data compromise').
Deductible applies to all 'loss' from the same 'wrongful act' or interrelated 'wrongful acts' insured under Data Compromise Liability, Network Security Liability or Electronic Media Liability.

In the event of a total loss or constructive total loss to Covered Property by a Covered Cause of Loss, the premium applicable to that Covered Property shall be fully earned and no return premium will be due to the Insured.
For Expense Reimbursement, 'identity recovery insured' must send receipts/records within 60 days of insurer's request.

The most the Companies will pay for loss, damage or expense under this endorsement arising from any one equipment breakdown is the applicable limit of liability shown in SECTION I — COVERAGES AND LIMITS OF LIABILITY, unless otherwise shown in a schedule. Coverage provided under this endorsement does not provide an additional amount of insurance.

Percentage of Loss Deductibles: If a deductible is expressed as a percentage of loss, Companies will not be liable for the indicated percentage of the gross amount of loss. If the dollar amount of such percentage is less than the indicated minimum deductible, the minimum deductible will be the applicable deductible.

Environmental, Safety and Efficiency Improvements: If covered equipment requires replacement due to an accident, Companies will pay additional cost to replace with equipment that is better for the environment, safer, or more energy/water efficient, up to 150% of like kind and quality. Does not apply to component parts or ACV property, and does not increase limits.
The LMA 5400 clause (Property Cyber and Data Endorsement) shall apply.
Identity Recovery Help Line available for assistance.
SECTION II – COVERED CAUSES OF LOSS, Exclusion B.5.- Pollution/Contamination, does not apply to the Hazardous Substances coverage provided within this endorsement.
Identity Recovery Coverage is subject to the Identity Recovery Limit.
If the Insured cancels this Policy or removes a Location, the short rate return premium is 90% of applicable pro-rata premium subject to any Minimum Earned Premium stipulations in the Policy.
Insured must not admit liability or settle without insurer's prior written consent.
Insurer not obligated to pay 'loss' or 'defense costs' or defend after limit of insurance is exhausted.
Computer Attack and Cyber Extortion Sublimits apply to Loss of Business, Public Relations, and Cyber Extortion coverages.
Lost Wages and Child and Elder Care Expenses are jointly subject to a sublimit and limited to expenses incurred within 12 months after first discovery of 'identity theft'.
Insurer has the right and duty to assume defense of applicable 'claim' or 'regulatory proceeding'.

Direct and Indirect Coverages Deductibles: Indirect Coverages Deductibles apply to Time Element loss and expense; Direct Coverages Deductibles apply to all remaining loss, damage or expense covered by this endorsement.
Supplemental Extended Reporting Period of one year upon payment of 100% of full annual premium, if requested in writing and paid within 30 days of 'termination of coverage'.
Insurer pays interest on judgment amount within limit after entry of judgment and before payment/offer to pay limit; these payments are in addition to the limit.

Exclusions b.(2)(a), b.(2)(b), b.(2)(c) and b.(2)(d) shall not apply if: The excluded cause of loss occurs away from any covered Location and causes an electrical surge or other electrical disturbance; Such surge or disturbance is transmitted through utility service transmission lines to the covered Location and results in an accident or electronic circuitry impairment; and The loss, damage or expense caused by such surge or disturbance is not covered elsewhere under the policy.
Bankruptcy or insolvency of insured does not relieve obligations.

Valuation: Payment for damaged Covered Property will be the smallest of: cost to repair, cost to replace on the same site, or amount actually spent to repair or replace. Based on the most cost-effective means to replace function, capacity, and useful life (may include generic, used, or reconditioned parts).
ACCIDENT and ELECTRONIC CIRCUITRY IMPAIRMENT are included as Listed Perils under SECTION II -- COVERED CAUSES OF LOSS, Exclusion B.4.b) - Asbestos.

SECTION II – COVERED CAUSES OF LOSS, Exclusion B.19. is deleted and replaced with: Loss or damage caused by a hydrostatic, pneumatic or gas pressure test of any boiler or pressure vessel, or an electrical insulation breakdown test of any type of electrical equipment.

<!-- Page 1 -->
# SOUTH CAROLINA HURRICANE, NAMED STORM OR WIND/HAIL DEDUCTIBLE DISCLOSURE NOTICE

THIS POLICY CONTAINS A SEPARATE DEDUCTIBLE FOR HURRICANE, NAMED STORM OR WIND/HAIL LOSSES, WHICH MAY RESULT IN HIGH OUT-OF-POCKET EXPENSES TO YOU. THE ENCLOSED EXAMPLE ILLUSTRATES HOW THE DEDUCTIBLE MIGHT AFFECT YOU.

LMA9168
12 December 2019

THIS NOTICE DOES NOT CHANGE ANY TERMS OF THIS POLICY. PLEASE REVIEW AND REFER TO THE POLICY FOR LIMITS, DEDUCTIBLES, AND DEFINITIONS OF HURRICANE, NAMED STORM, AND WINDSTORM OR HAIL.

## Example Illustration:

This policy includes a percentage deductible that will apply to loss or damage caused by Hurricane, Named Storm, or Windstorm or Hail. We will deduct an amount equal to 2% of the limit of insurance.

|  Limit of Insurance: | $100,000  |
| --- | --- |
|  Deductible: | 2% of the limit of insurance  |
|  Calculation of deductible: | $100,000 x 0.02 = $2,000  |
|  Amount of loss: | $50,000  |
|  Adjusted loss: | $50,000 - $2,000 = $48,000  |

AR SC DDN 10 20

Authorized Representative

1. The Compass Commercial Property Form, Section II, B, Exclusion 14 is deleted and replaced by the following:

Lack of incoming electricity, fuel, water, gas, steam, refrigerant, or outgoing sewerage, or incoming or outgoing data or telecommunications, all of which are caused by an Occurrence away from the Location(s) insured under this Policy, unless physical damage not excluded by this Policy results, in which event, this Policy shall cover only such resulting damage.

2. Terrorism is provided as per Form AR TERR 07 20, subject to:

a. Limit - As per schedule, Per Occurrence.
b. Deductible - $10,000 Per Occurrence.

3. Replacement Cost Valuation shall apply as regards to Real & Personal Property; Except roof coverings to be Actual Cash Value if originally installed or last fully replaced prior to 2011.

4. All Buildings with outstanding damage are excluded. Contact Underwriter if waiver needed.

5. Coverage explicitly excludes all Flood, including but not limited to Flood during windstorm events.

6. Coverage excludes all loss or damage directly or indirectly caused by any Named Storm in existence at time of written request to bind or inception of any new or additional exposure.

7. Any additional premium or return premium under $500 shall be waived, except additional premium for new perils or coverages added.

8. Warrant no Exterior Insulation Finish System (EIFS) Construction.

Printed/Issued On: 06/14/2023

Page 2

9. The complete named insured listing (if any) is per schedule on file with the Program Manager.

Printed/Issued On: 06/14/2023

<!-- Page 6 -->
CONTRACT ALLOCATION ENDORSEMENT

Effective Date: 5/17/2023

This insurance is effected with certain insurance underwriters (hereinafter called the "Underwriters"). The following words shall be deemed to be synonymous: "Underwriters", "Insurers" and "Company".

The liability of each Underwriter on this contract with the Insured is limited to the participation amount shown in the schedule below. The liability of each separate contract listed and for each Underwriter represented thereby for any loss or losses or amounts payable is several as to each and shall not exceed its participation percentage shown below and there is no joint liability of any Underwriters pursuant to this contract. An Underwriter shall not have its liability hereunder increased or decreased by reason of failure or delay of another Underwriter, its successors, assigns, or legal representatives. Any loss otherwise payable under the provisions of the attached policy that exceeds the allocation of "Risk" as defined herein shall be borne proportionately by the contracts as to their limit of liability at the time and place of the loss bears to the total allocated limits herein.

This contract shall be constructed as a separate contract between the Insured and each of the Underwriters. This evidence of coverage consists of separate sections of a composite insurance for all Underwriter's at Lloyd's combined and separate policies issued by the insurance company(ies), all as identified below. This evidence of coverage does not constitute in any manner or form a joint certificate of coverage by Underwriter's at Lloyd's wit
